page.title: 06MOULTON PARISH CHURCH (cont)
page.content: was added in the early 15th century. It has gargoyles at all four corners. Later still there was a small wooden spire on the top of the tower.This was removed in 1645.The church has a Nave,Chancel,North and South Aisles,a West tower and a South porch.At the East end of the parapet above the clerestory is a carved pig. On the South wall is a wooden sundial.Inside the church the pillars and arches on the North aisle differ in style,from the main part of the church.The organ dates from 1869. A section of the old font destroyed in 1816 can now be seen ie churchyard wall.The present dates from 1884. The are three piscinas.The church has contained bells since medieval times,making eight in 1934 another two were added in i974 making ten. The bells are still rung every Sunday at 8.00 am,11.00 am and 6.00p.m.
